Package Maze

Class Maze

java.lang.Object
Maze.Maze
public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
Maze holds all the Walls, Abilities, and Enemies on the screen and can be loaded from a .txt file
Author:
Chris

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected char[][] grid
    grid is a 2D char array initialized from Maze's constructor, indexes are at [row #][col #]

    int playerStartY

  • Constructor Details

    • Maze

      public Maze()
      Creates a maze with default arguments

    • Maze

      public Maze​(processing.core.PApplet marker, java.lang.String filename, int gridWidth, int gridHeight)
      Creates a maze with user specified arguments
      Parameters:
      marker - The PApplet to which the maze will be drawn
      filename - The file from which to get the maze
      gridWidth - width of the grid / number of columns
      gridHeight - height of the grid / number of rows

    • Maze

      public Maze​(Maze old, processing.core.PApplet marker)
      Construct a maze from another Maze. Skips reading the text file
      Parameters:
      old - the old maze
      marker - The PApplet to which the maze will be drawn

    • readData

      public void readData​(java.lang.String filename, char[][] gameData)
      Copied from Recursion in 2D arrays lab: GridTemplate.java
      Parameters:
      filename - name of the file to read characters from
      gameData - the 2D char array to store the characters in
      Precondition:
      char[][] gameData is initialized
      Postcondition:
      gameData will be filled with all the characters in the text file

    • printCharArray

      public void printCharArray​(char[][] chars)
      prints the specified 2D array of chars
      Parameters:
      chars - the 2d array to be printed
      Precondition:
      chars is a rectangular 2D char array that is initialized
